arch:property.oc:show_val: The east west length is 1.87 m-by-1.63 width north south-by- 2.15 m in height.

This pier is solidly constructed of sandstone ashlars set as headers and stretchers in alternating rows. Joining these blocks is mortar. Voussoirs are placed to rest on one course of stretchers, and two courses of these arches extend into the area to be covered. Each of the piers has arches extending at each end of the pierÂ—thus each pier carries four arches.
In the middle pier wall of the West Cryptoporticus, fifth pier from the south.
Arch Pier #5 from Locus 12 in the south
Locus 19 the middle pier wall of the West Cryptoporticus and Locus 16, the step ledge of the Locus 19 wall.

Phase IV: Nabataean Grand Design: 1st c. BCE to CE 1st c. The full Lower Temenos is constructed, complete with additional subterranean channels and drains, the Hexagonal Pavement, the East and West Triple Colonnades and Cryptoportici, the East and West Exedrae and the Lower Temenos Retaining Wall. East west crosswall is built in the West Cryptoporticus ca. 20 m north of the West Exedra.
Loci 4-8 to the south, Locus 10 the other pier to the north, and Locus 19 the wall under the piers.
Also abuts soil Loci 1, 3, 13, and 17 in the west sector and Locus 21 in the east sector of West Cryptoporticus.
Locus 19 the lower middle pier wall.
